p.a: libffi - a portable foreign function interface library
Free mind / On the Rubinius FFI

div.p: I’m trying to build a debian package for rubinius, my knowledges about vm and c compiling are very litle, but… here we go!
I’m going to see required libs to run rubinius
div.pre:
[gramos@marlasina] cd ~/src/rubinius/
[gramos@marlasina] ldd shotgun/lib/librubinius-0.9.0.so
linux-gate.so.1 => (0xffffe000) libz.so.1 => /usr/lib/libz.so.1 (0xb7dfa000) libm.so.6 => /lib/libm.so.6 (0xb7dd5000) libdl.so.2 => /lib/libdl.so.2 (0xb7dd1000) librt.so.1 => /lib/librt.so.1 (0xb7dc7000) libcrypt.so.1 => /lib/libcrypt.so.1 (0xb7d95000) libc.so.6 => /lib/libc.so.6 (0xb7c60000) /lib/ld-linux.so.2 (0x80000000) libpthread.so.0 => /lib/libpthread.so.0 (0xb7c49000)
[gramos@marlasina] dlocate /usr/lib/libz.so.1
zlib1g: /usr/lib/libz.so.1.2.3.3 zlib1g: /usr/lib/libz.so.1
div.p: As we can see, the package’s name is zlib1g
div.pre:
[gramos@marlasina] dpkg -l | grep zlib1g
ii zlib1g 1:1.2.3.3.dfsg-12 compression library - runtime ii zlib1g-dev 1:1.2.3.3.dfsg-12 compression library - development
[gramos@marlasina] ldd /usr/lib/libz.so.1 linux-gate.so.1 => (0xffffe000) libc.so.6 => /lib/libc.so.6 (0xb7df6000) /lib/ld-linux.so.2 (0x80000000)
[gramos@marlasina] dlocate /lib/libc.so.6 libc6: /lib/libc.so.6
[gramos@marlasina] dlocate /lib/libdl.so.2 libc6: /lib/libdl.so.2
[gramos@marlasina] dlocate /lib/librt.so.1 libc6: /lib/librt.so.1
[gramos@marlasina] dlocate /lib/libcrypt.so.1 libc6: /lib/libcrypt.so.1
[gramos@marlasina] dlocate /lib/libpthread.so.0 libc6: /lib/libpthread.so.0
[gramos@marlasina] dpkg -l | grep libc6
ii libc6 2.7-10 GNU C Library: Shared libraries ii libc6-dev 2.7-10 GNU C Library: Development Libraries and Headers
div.p: As we can see, the package’s name is libc6, in theory only two libs are required: libc6 (>= 2.4) and zlib1g.
